explanation:
<think>
At  [0-1], the boy in the gray sweatshirt and the little girl in red clothing are seen moving towards the curtain. The boy appears to be holding the curtain open, allowing the girl to look outside. This suggests that the curtain is being moved or adjusted at least once. There is no indication of the curtain being moved again in this segment. Given the limited information from this segment, the curtain changes position once.

Considering the options provided, Option B (Once) aligns with the observed action in this segment. There is no evidence to suggest the curtain changes position more than once in this short clip.
</think>
<answer>B</answer>

<think>
At  [1-5], the boy pulls back the curtain to reveal the glass door, and later the woman in the brown sweater rushes in and adjusts the curtain again. This indicates the curtain is moved at least twice. Earlier, at [0-1], the boy was holding the curtain open, suggesting it was moved once before. This aligns with the curtain changing position twice in the video. Option C (Twice) fits this observation, as the curtain is moved more than once but not as many as three or four times.
</think>
<answer>C</answer>
